job_title: Client & Creditor Liaison in New Westminster, BC
pros: Team that you actively work with. Work from home.
cons: Salary / compensation. For a non profit organization where we turn a good profit, that stands for financial well being, they can not pay a livable wage as determent by the city. ( as a side note, Program Managers average around 142'000 + management bonuses, while Client & Creditor Liaison make 51'000 (after being with the company over 5 years) which is essentially a case manager and arguably the hardest job) No inflation adjustments, no company parties or team events. Hierarchical . The only valued employees in this company are the counsellors and management, everyone else is viewed as 2nd tier. Sleazy. They do some back door shananagens, and when someone calls them out on it, they make a 1 on 1 or small group meeting with head of HR which gives you convoluted answer which does not answer the questions. And you feel pressured not to pursue the topic. Transparency. Management actively tries to fog the lens / trench each person in, so they do not share any information. Political. You actively have to play politics to feel secure in your job.
Bad management. Office culture was bad

review_title: We help, we educate, we give hope!
job_title: Credit Counsellor in New Westminster, BC
pros: Feel good about what you do.
cons: Can be stressful hearing client's problems.

pros: Worked here for 5 years and just had enough. It was a great place to work at first, however as soon as they started to expand their perspective changed. Unrealistic targets, managers began to harp down counselors to convert calls to payment programs. They have this system where dependent on the calls a counselor takes, there is a ratio in which they need to convert into payment programs. If a counselor took an extra call to help a desperate client in need and  provided them with information that was not converted to a payment program a manager would be on your case on why your month ratios are off.
cons: - They started to promote employees who had no skill set in how to manage a team into managers. Felt like they were promoted because they knew how to crack the whip to get the monthly target numbers. Started to feel less like I was out there to help clients, rather to make sure I get my months targets so I don't reprimanded by my superiors.

job_title: Credit Counsellor in Port Coquitlam, BC
pros:
Very gratifying career knowing you can help, educate, and give hope to everyone that contacts your office.
Non-profit...  what a great feeling to tell our client's that our consultations are free and confidential. 
Employees are all one big team and work here for the same reason.
Leadership team are very caring and stand behind their employees 100%.
Excellent salaries and benefits.
Provide on-going in house training to keep every employee informed of the latest trends.  What's happening in the economy.    Provide training so we can communicate with our client's and help with their emotional needs as well. 
All Counsellors are Accreditated and must obtain Continuing Education Units.  The Society helps their Counsellors meet these objectives by providing in house training. 
Over 98% of our client's that are surveyed would recommend our services to others.     That shows how much we truly care about each client.
cons: At this time I cannot think of any and I have been here for over 10 yrs.
